Package renderer

Class Camera

java.lang.Object
renderer.Camera
public class Camera extends Object
The Camera class represents a virtual camera used for rendering images through ray tracing. It defines the camera's position, orientation, field of view, and provides methods for generating rays for each pixel on the view plane. Authors: Noga Jacobs and Noa

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructs a camera with the specified position and orientation.

  • Constructor Details

    • Camera

      public Camera(Point p0, Vector vto, Vector vup)
      Constructs a camera with the specified position and orientation.
      Parameters:
      p0 - The position of the camera (center of the lens).
      vto - The vector representing the direction towards the view plane.
      vup - The vector representing the upward direction of the camera.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the given direction vectors are not orthogonal.

    • constructRay

      public Ray constructRay(int nX, int nY, int j, int i)
      Constructs a ray passing through a specific pixel on the view plane.
      Parameters:
      nX - The number of pixels in the X direction of the view plane.
      nY - The number of pixels in the Y direction of the view plane.
      j - The pixel's X coordinate (column index).
      i - The pixel's Y coordinate (row index).
      Returns:
      Ray The constructed ray passing through the specified pixel.

    • PointMiddle

      public Point PointMiddle(int nX, int nY, int j, int i)
      Calculates the point in the middle of a pixel on the viewing plane.
      Parameters:
      nX - The width of the viewing plane (number of pixels in the x-direction).
      nY - The height of the viewing plane (number of pixels in the y-direction).
      j - The x-coordinate of the pixel location.
      i - The y-coordinate of the pixel location.
      Returns:
      The point in the middle of the specified pixel on the viewing plane.

    • constructRayS

      public List<Ray> constructRayS(int nX, int nY, int j, int i)
      Antialiasing Function for calculating that a list of rays intersects the pixel
      Parameters:
      nX - -size of view plan
      nY - -size of view plan
      j - - Pixel Location
      i - - Pixel Location
      Returns:
      List of rays cut

    • writeToImage

      public Camera writeToImage()
      Writes the final rendered image to the file specified in the ImageWriter. This method should be called after rendering the image.
      Returns:
      This Camera object.

    • printGrid

      public void printGrid(int gap, Color intervalColor)
      * Print Grid call to func writePixel turn on printGrid with gap and intervalColor the func get
      Parameters:
      gap - -
      intervalColor - -color

    • renderImage

      public void renderImage()
      Renders the image using ray tracing. This method generates rays for each pixel in the view plane and traces those rays to determine the color of each pixel. It takes into account anti-aliasing and super-sampling settings if enabled.

    • constructRaySSuperSampling

      public List<Ray> constructRaySSuperSampling(double Rx, double Ry, Point pointCenter)
      Parameters:
      Rx - The width of the sub-pixel in the X direction.
      Ry - The width of the sub-pixel in the Y direction.
      pointCenter - The center point of the pixel.
      Returns:
      The list of rays used for super-sampling at the specified pixel.

    • PointSuperSampling

      public Point PointSuperSampling(double Rx, double Ry, Point pointCenter, int counter)
      Returns the new center point of a sub-pixel for super-sampling at the specified pixel. This method is used to calculate the center point of each sub-pixel within the main pixel.
      Parameters:
      Rx - The width of the sub-pixel in the X direction.
      Ry - The width of the sub-pixel in the Y direction.
      pointCenter - The center point of the main pixel.
      counter - The counter indicating the sub-pixel's position (1, 2, 3, or 4).
      Returns:
      Point The center point of the sub-pixel for super-sampling.
